about_the_game:
Convergence Compulsion is an arcade-style, score-attack game that balances thinking fast and planning ahead. Converge on the wave that matches your color. Explode into a new color. Get points, earn power-ups, and blast your way to a high score!

Move quickly, or you'll get consumed by the wrong wave! But don't stray too far, or you'll never get back for that matching color! Each time you match, an obstacle appears, and after you string more matches together, you'll get power-ups!

Key Features

  • Blast, shoot, scoot, and smash—Clear a path to your next high score with an arsenal of power-ups that you can use alone or together.
  • Unlock dozens of secrets—Discover the codes that grant you power-up tricks, character cosmetics, and more.
  • Climb to the top—Face off against your friends, and the world, as you vie for the highest of high scores.
  • Track your progress—Celebrate locally tracked gameplay milestones and unlock achievements to show off your prowess.
  • Play your way—Tailor the game with loads of options from configurable controls to customizable colors.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 14.04+
  • Processor: 2GHz
  • Memory: 256 MB RAM
  • Storage: 25 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Standard audio
  • Additional Notes: Be advised, this game was made in Game Maker Studio 2, which supports only a subset of Linux distros.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: OS X version 10.6 or later
  • Processor: 2GHz
  • Memory: 256 MB RAM
  • Storage: 25 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Standard audio
  • Additional Notes: The game is compiled as a 32-bit executable. This might not run on certain newer versions of the OS. A 64-bit executable will be made available soon.
